Job Summary:
As a member of the pension actuarial consulting unit, this position assists in the examination for regulatory and professional compliance of pension plan actuarial filings submitted to the Financial Services Regulatory Authority. 


Using specific guidelines, the incumbent will update the actuarial database for new actuarial filings, review filings and identify/report potential areas of concern to senior actuarial staff. 


The incumbent may also be asked to assist on special assignments and projects as assigned.
Job Responsibilities:
Pension Plan Actuarial Filings: 

1. Analysis of Professional & Regulatory Requirements 

    - Complete a pre-determined checklist using information in filed reports/certificates. 

    - Analyze methods and assumptions used to determine the actuarial value of assets. 

    - Analyze statements made by the actuary for consistency with professional requirements. 

    - Ensure statements are complete and consistent with information presented in the reports. 


2. Risk Assessment & Reporting 

    - Using a set of guidelines, determine whether a report fails to meet all requirements of the guidelines, or represents a potentially high risk case. 

   - For those reports that fail to meet all requirements or represent potential high risk, refer these to senior actuarial staff, and include supporting written analysis. 

   - For those plans that meet all requirements and are not considered high risk, advise senior actuarial staff that requirements have been met. 

  - Compile statistics related to reviews and report on findings to senior actuarial staff. 


3. Data Validation 

    - Verify actuarial valuation data from pension plan reports and other filings. 

    - Ensure plan summary used as a valuation base is consistent with terms of the pension plan. 

    - Ensure membership data upon which the valuation is based is consistent with Annual Information Returns and/or actuarial reports previously filed. 


Other Activities: 

  - Check the reasonableness of submitted actuarial reports, including going-concern liabilities, solvency liabilities, wind up liabilities and commuted values of benefits, using computer programmes, modifying where necessary. 

  - Complete additional duties as assigned.
Required Skills: The successful candidate will be familiar with actuarial science theory, have strong analytical skills, good communication skills, and an ability to work with great accuracy under minimal supervision. Knowledge of pension plans and pension financing would be an asset.

Job Summary:
